verbose_text: Therefore, when the glucose concentration in circulation increases after a meal, the increased ATP/ADP (adenosine diphosphate) ratio in beta-cells initiates the closing of ATP sensitive K-channels, thus depolarizing the plasma membrane and activating voltage gated L-type Ca2 + channels to stimulate Ca2 + -dependent exocytosis of insulin containing secretory granules [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: glucose concentration in circulation increases after a meal, the increased ATP/ADP (adenosine diphosphate) ratio in beta-cells initiates the closing of ATP
